text: When I was filming Jamie Cooks Italy,
my old mate Giuseppe took me out on a
cocktail tour of Turin. We tried some
lovely aperitivo food and cocktails, and
visited a couple of different bars. Some
traditional and some more modern.
He introduced me to Dennis and together we
made a twist on the breakfast martini.
Made with bitter orange marmalade, lemon
juice and bergamot. All served up with a
little surprise. Let's go...
We have the perfect breakfast martini.
Here we're we placing it in here, nice bread aroma
It's like a croissant early morning shot.
We are going to keep it in the bag Jamie and tomorrow morning
when we going to wake up, yourself and
myself and Gennaro we are going to have a
beautiful breakfast martini!
But I couldn't wait until breakfast to try it!
Salute!
Delicioso!
We were just leaving this beautiful aperitivo bar, when we met a
complete stranger that wanted to feed
us octopus, it was brilliant!
We've just met this young lady, very
random outside the cocktail bar and
she's a chef and she's told me about... Come on
she said she's a cook but she's a
chef and she cooks polpo, octopus.
So what is one to do in Torino, if a young
lady offers you some octopus? I say go
and try it
So where's your shop then? Just up here?
Yeah, we'll go now.
So you're gonna open up your shop, just to
give me some octopus?
Now we're gonna try now, try now? Yeah of course
we are! We're not mucking about! Come on.
Nice kitchen!
She marinates the octopus first, in salt
sugar, white wine, red wine, Muscovado and
black pepper and then the next day, she
boils it in water until tender then she
throws it in the smoker.
It does look and smell amazing and she's
now frying it up, getting it super super
crispy. It's lovely you know a lot of
passion, marinating, cooking, smoking and now
she's frying. That's four stages of
cooking from a complete stranger.
Try this with it, what is it? It's onion, red onions, onion like a jam
Marmellata? Yeah
Come on then,
It's so crispy on the outside and so tender in
the middle.
I love octopus... Wow!
The saltiness with the Octopus, with the
sweetness of the caramelised onion. Wow!
Mmmm. Delicioso!
That is really good! Yeah well
that's why I followed her because I
believed her, I could see it in her eyes.
It was delicious, thank you. Thank you.
Bye Jamie, take care!
Next time I'm in Turin I'll come and see you.
That's why I love the Italians.
